column4: can audacity split an audio-file into smaller own files by setting markers?

histo obviously this kernel is not able to work with the network card (asus eee 1005ha)
obviously, how is reverting to an older kernel going to fix that?
are you trying to get the ethernet or wirless card to work?
because it does not work any more since a new kernel was installed
best check that its enabled in the bios, fwiw, the kernel updates only pertain to small revisions, so the previous kernel you used is not .31 which isnt even used by ubuntu
it is how to change the kernel
i used the 31.10 rt before and there it worked
if it doesnot show in lspci changing the kernel wont fix your problem, to change a kernel install the appropriate kernel version package or build one yourself
